intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. caesium, commonly known as Caesar's weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. It is native to Europe and has been introduced to other parts of the world. Its common name reflects its historical use in herbal medicine and its striking appearance.
